theoryTitle: Davy Back Fight Foreshadows Luffy vs Shanks Competition
theoryText: The Davy Back Fight introduced in the Long Ring Long Land arc serves as foreshadowing for a future competition between Luffy's Straw Hat Pirates and Shanks' Red Hair Pirates. Since both crews are friendly and neither Luffy nor Shanks would want to harm each other in actual combat, a Davy Back Fight would allow them to compete honorably without ill-intent. This would enable matchups like Usopp vs Yasopp (his father) in a shooting contest, Sanji vs Lucky Roux in cooking/speed challenges, and ultimately Luffy vs Shanks in the Combat game, mirroring Luffy vs Foxy from Long Ring Long Land.
author: One Piece Fan Community
supportingEvidence: Oda rarely includes content without purpose, suggesting the Davy Back Fight has future significance
The relationship between Luffy and Shanks makes direct combat unlikely
A Davy Back Fight would allow the crews to compete while maintaining their friendship
Recent manga developments have renewed interest in this theory

theoryTitle: Long Ring Long Land Arc Demonstrates Oda's Long-Term Planning
theoryText: Many fans theorize that the Long Ring Long Land arc, despite being widely disliked, was intentionally placed between Skypeia and Water 7 to serve multiple purposes: providing a lighter tone before the intense Water 7 saga, introducing the Davy Back Fight concept for future use, and demonstrating different types of pirate traditions in the One Piece world. The arc's seemingly 'filler-like' nature may be deliberate misdirection, hiding important foreshadowing that will pay off later in the series.
author: One Piece Analysis Community
supportingEvidence: The arc provides tonal contrast before the darker Water 7 saga
Introduces unique pirate traditions that expand world-building
Oda has a track record of planting seeds for future plot points
The Davy Back Fight could connect to the Rocks Pirates and their history

theoryTitle: Davy Back Fight Connected to Rocks Pirates History
theoryText: Some fans theorize that the Davy Back Fight tradition may have historical connections to the legendary Rocks Pirates, potentially explaining how such a powerful crew with conflicting personalities stayed together. The tradition could have been used by Rocks D. Xebec to recruit or maintain crew members, which would give the Long Ring Long Land arc deeper significance in understanding pirate history and the Will of D.
author: One Piece Theory Community
supportingEvidence: The Rocks Pirates had members who later became rivals, suggesting unusual recruitment methods
Davy Back Fights are described as an old pirate tradition
Recent manga chapters have increased focus on Rocks Pirates history
The connection would explain why Oda included this arc in the story
